1561221618_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc3.body:
"If individually you don't understand how things work, using a ubuntu or using a windows is the same"
Although ubuntu has its own privacy issues I disagree with the premise that you can not trust experts to verify the quality or security of a product for you.
If you would trust your doctor to perform a kidney transplant then it stands to reason that a group of computer experts who create and peer review a fully free software distro like Debian for example especially if Debian gets round to fully implementing reproducible builds (https://isdebianreproducibleyet.com/).

not that their aren't security concerns with many distros I am just saying that a user need not become an expert to be secure in their computing at least in theory.

also gnu guix looks promising https://www.gnu.org/software/guix/about
